outcome_var: 1 stands for a group paid all installments on time until the survey took place, otherwise 0
outcome_description: defaulters are those group borrowers with minimum default for 91-180 days past due
predictor_var: 1 if group members regularly visit other group members
predictor_info: used as proxy for peer monitoring
covariate_1: 1 if the sample group borrower is male and 0 otherwise
covariate_2: 1 if borrowers have other source of credit available and 0 otherwise
covariate_3: 1 if group members know for what purpose the other members have used the loan
covariate_4: 1 if group members know the monthly sales of the other group members
covariate_5: 1 if groups have rules and regulation on how to run the group
covariate_6: 1 if group members help one another in times of need
covariate_7: 1 if group has ever rejected a borrower who would like to join the group
covariate_8: 1 if members are willing to put pressure other members in to repaying
covariate_9: 1 if the member feels anger against defaulting member
covariate_10: 1 if there is a penalty within the group for defaulting members
covariate_11: 1 if group members knew the other group member/s before the group was formed
covariate_12: 1 if group members born in the same area where the survey was held
covariate_13: 1 if group member has ever been a member of another group
covariate_14: number of follow up and supervisory visits made by the DECSI loan officer

outcome_var: 1 if the group succeeds in respecting his contract towards the lender, otherwise 0
outcome_description: External Delinquency replicated the second stage of the repayment decision when the repayment was due
predictor_var: 1 if the group members visit each other
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: The average distance (in meter) between the member and the other group members
covariate_2: 1 if the group has regulations and internal laws to reach there
covariate_3: 1 if all group members have the same business
covariate_4: 1 if the member knows the other group members before the formation of the group
covariate_5: The length in number of year spent by the borrower in the same region
covariate_6: Length (in month) during which the borrower was member of his group to the deadline of the loan
covariate_7: 1: will to make pressure to incite repayment
covariate_8: 1 if the group rejects a borrower who wants to join it
covariate_9: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same age (+/-2 years)
covariate_10: 1 if all the group have the same sex
covariate_11: 1 if the borrower and the leader of his group have the same level of education
covariate_13: 1 if the group member is female
covariate_14: 1 if the borrower has at least 6 years of education
covariate_15: 1 if the group member is married
covariate_16: 1 if the group member has other sources of money
covariate_17: number of members in the group
covariate_18: 1 if the MFI puts at the disposal of borrowers non financial services
covariate_19: 1 if the borrower would have liked to borrow more than the assigned amount
covariate_20: 1 if the relation is very intimate, 0 elsewhere

outcome_var: 1 if the group leader indicates that at least one member has ever misused a loan
outcome_description: By misuse we mean that a member has used the loan for other purposes than he/she initially indicated when obtaining the loan. If misuse of loans is reported this may indicate moral hazard behavior of group members.
predictor_var: 1 if the group member regularly visits the other group members.
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: average distance (in meters) between the group member and the other members of the group
covariate_2: 1 if the group member knows the other group members before forming the group
covariate_3: 1 if the group member has ever been member of another group
covariate_4: monthly income of the group member (in Nakfas)
covariate_5: the value a group member attaches to having access to loans from the credit program in the future, rang- ing from 1 (= very high value) to 4 (= very low value)
covariate_6: 1 if all group members are of the same sex

outcome_var: 1 if a group had at least one late repayment and 0 if the group paid all installments on time up until the survey interview took place (over the last nine months)
outcome_description: Suvery question: In the last 9 months, is there any group member who has an outstanding debt?
predictor_var: 1 if the monthly visits between members are greater than or equal to 7
predictor_info: Used as a measure of monitoring
covariate_1: 1 if at least one member has an informal source of credit
covariate_2: Number of years since the group took its first loan to the day the survey was conducted
covariate_3: 1 if members are of the same sex
covariate_4: 1 if members belong to the same ethnic group
covariate_5: 1 if members are of the same religion
covariate_6: 1 if members live in the same district and know each other before forming the group
covariate_7: 1 if members have the same occupations
covariate_8: 1 if members apply social pressure on defaulters
covariate_9: 1 if the average distance between members businesses is greater than or equal to one km
covariate_10: Number of people in the group
covariate_11: 1 if members have ever rejected someone who would like to join the group

outcome_var: 1 if group has average arrears of < 3 days per loan and no loans in arrears > 7 days
outcome_description: A group received a dummy variable equal to one if they were by FUNDAP's own criteria, a `problem-free' group. These groups had never been more than seven days late with any loan, and had average arrears of less than three days per loan.
predictor_var: 1 if members know weekly sales of other members
predictor_info: Used as a measure of peer monitoring
covariate_1: 1 if group consists of either all men or all women.
covariate_2: Number of years members acquainted before group
covariate_3: 1 if all members say all were friends before group
covariate_4: 1 if members partake in joint social activities
covariate_5: 1 if willingness to pressure others to repay
covariate_6: 1 if members feel applying sanctions dif®cult
covariate_7: Number of members in borrowing group
covariate_8: 1 if state moral obligation to repay group loan
covariate_9: 1 if say repay to stay on good terms with group
covariate_10: Average distance in kilometers between members' businesses
covariate_11: 1 if members engaged in same line of business
covariate_12: 1 if at least one member has other credit access
covariate_13: Number of months in term of group loan
covariate_14: Number of years since borrowing group took first group loan

outcome_var: 1 for group members that had unresolved repayment problems after due date
predictor_var: 1 if borrower knew other members’ activities
predictor_info: captures knowledge on activities of partners before group formation, which is useful information to discern partners of their choice.
covariate_2: 1 if borrower thinks he/she joined its “optimum” group
covariate_4: Distance (in KM) between major economic activities of group members
covariate_5: 1 if repay only because of moral obligation
covariate_6: 1 if borrower feels asset confiscation/prison is worst penalty upon default (compared to subsequent social problems)
covariate_7: 1 if participated in networks (e.g., Equb, Edir, Tsebel, etc.) with one or more group members
covariate_8: 1 if other (informal) sources of credit exist

outcome_description: Delinquency is not paying a loan repayment installment on time according to a predetermined schedule... Peer groups were coded for whether they had experienced loan delinquency or default but not for the frequency of occurrence
predictor_var: 1 if peer monitoring index was greater than 0.5
predictor_info: Peer group monitoring activities include level of attendance at regular group meetings, frequency of discussing each other’s business situations at group meetings, and various types of networking outside these meetings.
covariate_1: 1 if staff monitoring index was greater than 0.5
covariate_4: High costs of nonrepayment and benefits of repayment
covariate_7: Average credit risk of members in the same group
covariate_8: Percentage of women in a group
covariate_10: Group members' prior experience times number of years in business

outcome_description: borrower i’s repayment response given in contract j in round t
predictor_var: 1 if the subject opted for monitoring the repayment decision of his counterpart and zero otherwise in round
predictor_info: If a subject chose to monitor, he/she had to pay a monitoring fee of 2000 points (these points were deducted from the final payoff at the end of all rounds). Given the choice of monitoring, the other group member had to pay a fine/penalty of 5000 points if he decides to default on his loan (these fines were to be deducted from the final payoff at the end of all rounds)
covariate_4: Participant education level: Undergraduate = 0, Graduate = 1, Postgraduate = 2

outcome_description: The study measures borrowers’ repayment behavior considering their loan delinquency for a period of 30 days. A borrower is expected to make the repayment as per the prescribed schedule. The loan delinquency arises when the scheduled repayments are delayed. A borrower is designated as loan delinquent if s/he misses the installments for a period of 1 month or repays the same by resorting to borrowing
predictor_var: Do you attempt to know or monitor the loan utilization of the other members? (No = 1, Yes = 0)
covariate_1: Does MFI staff supervise the loan utilization, economic activities of the household (No = 1, Yes = 0)
covariate_2: Do you have the feeling that you might be socially sanctioned in case of failure to repay the loan? (No = 1, Yes = 0)
covariate_3: Index based upon total household asset measured assigning relative weights to household items (weights are allotted on basis of asset probable market price)
covariate_4: Ratio of family size to economically independent
covariate_5: Primary occupation of borrower:  Non-Agriculture = 1, Agriculture = 0
covariate_6: Average age of family adult members
covariate_7: Square of average age of family adult members
covariate_8: Mode year of schooling attained in a family
covariate_10: Do the borrower exhibits regular saving behavior (Yes = 1, No = 0)
covariate_11: Years of availing loans (MFI or SHG)
covariate_14: Natural log of total loan outstanding
covariate_15: Percentage of loan diverted from intended income generating activity
covariate_17: Do you feel responsible to repayments of the other members of your group? (No = 1, Yes = 0)
